intro: Daphnopsis hispaniolica, commonly known as the Hispaniola daphnopsis, is a shrub native to the island of Hispaniola. It belongs to the family Ericaceae and is characterized by its compact growth habit and evergreen foliage. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically pink or white in color. It thrives in well-drained, acidic soils and prefers partial to full sun exposure. Daphnopsis hispaniolica is often found in forest understories and rock formations, showcasing its adaptability to diverse microhabitats.
